abstract: The rate inquiry escalated. | Chinese companies shopped abroad. | The Deal Professor called for the S.E.C. to re-examine old regulations. | DealBook’s special section examined business between worlds. | HSBC agreed to pay nearly $2 billion to settle charges over money laundering.
snippet: The rate inquiry escalated. | Chinese companies shopped abroad. | The Deal Professor called for the S.E.C. to re-examine old regulations. | DealBook’s special section examined business between worlds. | HSBC agreed to pay nearly $2 billion to sett...
lead_paragraph: The rate inquiry escalated. | Chinese companies shopped abroad. | The Deal Professor called for the S.E.C. to re-examine old regulations. | DealBook’s special section examined business between worlds. | HSBC agreed to pay nearly $2 billion to settle charges over money laundering. | Mongolia’s investment prospects dimmed. | The Treasury Department sold its A.I.G. shares. | Amgen said it would buy a firm working on gene links to diseases.

headline.main: Week in Review: Rate-Rigging Scandal Keeps Growing
